definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: A majority party nominee usually has the advantage of support over a minority party one. A major-party nominee always gets higher approval rating than a minor-party nominee.
sentences.chinese: 多數黨被提名者得到的支持率往往高出少數黨候選人。

sentences.english: Who is the Senate Majority Leader now?
sentences.chinese: 現任國會參院多數黨領袖是誰？

sentences.english: The president appoints the leader of the majority party or majority coalition as prime minister.
sentences.chinese: 總統任命多數黨或黨派聯盟的領導爲總理。

sentences.english: Usually a major-party nominee has a higher approval rating than a minor-party nominee.
sentences.chinese: 多數黨被提名者得到的支持率往往高出少數黨候選人。

sentences.english: A major party nominee usually gets higher approval rating than a minor-party nominee.
sentences.chinese: 多數黨被提名者得到的支持率往往高出少數黨候選人。

sentences.english: A major-party nominee usually has the advantage of support over a minor-party candidate.
sentences.chinese: 多數黨被提名者得到的支持率往往高出少數黨候選人。

sentences.english: The donkey symbolizes the Democratic Party, which currently is the majority party in the U.S. Congress.
sentences.chinese: 驢則是現美國國會多數黨民主黨的標誌。

sentences.english: One of the great consequences of the system is that it produces majorities automatically.
sentences.chinese: 這種制度的最大結果就是它自動地產生了多數黨。

sentences.english: Majority Leader Hoyer suggested that negotiations could extend through next week.
sentences.chinese: 多數黨領袖霍耶認爲，談判可能延長到下週。
